Some general comments.

1. There is never ever a reason to call new String(=
"literal string"). Ever. Please replace those calls with just "literal stri=
ng".
2. Make the indentation of this code consistent, please. I cannot even=
 begin to read it.
3. Don't use the method name "test". It doesn't mean any=
thing and could confuse the TestRunner.

I just don't understand at all wha=
t your suite() method is trying to do. It seems to add some number of copie=
s of the same test method to the suite, which looks to me to do nothing mor=
e than repeat the same test over and over again.

I guess that the suite() =
method throws a runtime exception when it executes. Given how complex it is=
, there is no way for me to understand what it's trying to do.

What is it =
that you're trying to do here? I am thoroughly confused.

So said Weber, Wo=
lfgang on 3/9/2003 --------------------
Hi Jason (and all the others)! 

Se=
cond try for the code. You can download it from the Files-Section inside th=
e group. Its name is sources.zip, subtitled with "couldn't invoke the suite=
()-method()". I hope you can find it:--))

I've checked the directory you a=
sked me to do, but there was no jar-File. 

What kind of JDK VAG uses I don=
't really know, outside VAJ I use SUN's JKD, hope that helps...:--)))

Bye

Wolfgang,

First, I saw no code.  I=
f you attached it as a file, it is probably being stripped.  You have two c=
hoices here, inline the code with the message or put it in the 'Files' sect=
ion of this group and let us know where it is.

Now on to the point of the =
message:

Curious.  This is totally different behavior, as you can see.  He=
re the suite was invoked.  I see nothing in the trace to lead me to a concl=
usion though.  However, about your classpath -- look in your <jdk-install-d=
irectory>/lib/ext.  Is there a crimson.jar, xerces.jar, or xercesImpl.jar? =
 If so, you will need to purge them.  The JDK 1.3 automatically takes anyth=
ing in the lib/ext directory and prepends it to your classpath.

Also, I as=
sume you are using SUN's JDK.  Is that so?

One other note, if you compile =
with debugging information you will get the line number in the stack trace.=


=3Djason
